intro: Phalaris arundinacea var. leioclada, commonly known as the silver reed, is a perennial grass native to Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can grow up to 2 meters in height, often forming dense clumps. The leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, with a silver-green hue that gives the plant its common name. It produces panicles of small, greenish-white flowers in late summer, which are followed by long, narrow seed spikes. This variety is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its graceful appearance and ability to thrive in wet or moist conditions.
